value.name: Scottish Labour MPs should be whipped in Gaza ceasefire vote – SNP
value.description: The SNP is calling on Scottish Labour to whip its two MPs to vote for an immediate ceasefire in Gaza, ahead of a vote in the House of Commons next week. On Saturday, Scottish Labour’s conference is expected to pass a motion calling for an immediate ceasefire in the conflict.

value.name: ‘Come together’ Sunak tells Conservatives after twin by-election blow
value.description: Rishi Sunak has called on British conservatives to ‘come together’, after a bruising set of by-election defeats in Wellingborough and Kingswood.

value.name: E4 Married At First Sight's Tasha Jay hits out over claims she's 'on the rocks' with Paul Liba
value.description: Married At First Sight star Tasha Jay has it out at claims she has split with partner Paul Liba after reports claimed the couple had not spent Valentine's Day together

value.name: Esther McVey appears to blame Covid lockdown backers for UK recession
value.description: The "minister for common sense" has appeared to blame "everybody who voted for lockdown" for the dip in the economic climate

value.name: Donald Trump fined 364 million dollars in civil fraud case
value.description: The civil trial lasted for two and a half months and Mr Trump’s lawyers have already confirmed they will appeal the decision.

value.name: Democrats relieved as Manchin rules out White House bid
value.description: Democrats were concerned that an independent bid could help deliver the White House to the Republicans in November's election. Mr Manchin finally ended the speculation on Friday, and seemed to acknowledge that the prospect of such unintended consequences was a factor in his decision not to run.

value.name: Nigel Farage considers comeback as Reform party leader
value.description: Nigel Farage has hinted he could return to frontline politics as leader of Reform UK, after the party’s strongest electoral showing at a by-election. While Labour flipped two seats vacated by Conservative MPs,

value.name: Prince Harry speaks out at Invictus event after addressing Royal Family dynamic
value.description: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle travelled to Canada this week and while there, the Duke of Sussex spoke at the closing event of the One Year to Go activities for the Invictus Games

video.name: Prince Harry discusses visiting King Charles on GMA

value.name: Russian diplomats 'summoned' by UK Foreign Office over 'murder' of Putin opponent Alexei Navalny - as world leaders condemn death of Putin critic
value.description: The Foreign Office said today it has 'summoned the Russian Embassy to make clear that we hold the Russian authorities fully responsible' for the death of Navalny, 47.

value.name: Transcript: Tories reel from by-election blows
value.description: Lucy Fisher talks to George Parker, Rafe Uddin, elections guru Professor Sir John Curtice and the FT’s foreign editor Alec Russell

value.name: Biden 'contemplating' steps to punish Moscow as world leaders blame 'monster' Putin for Navalny's death
value.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has described Mr Navalny as the "fiercest advocate for Russian democracy", while French President Emmanuel Macron said his death shows the "weakness of the Kremlin and their fear of all opponents".

value.name: Lockdown backers to blame for UK recession, suggests minister
value.description: The Government’s “minister for common sense” has appeared to blame “everybody who voted for lockdown” for the British economy’s dip into recession. Cabinet Office Minister Esther McVey made the claim during an appearance on BBC Radio 4’s Any Questions, as she faced questions about who voters should hold responsible for the lack of growth.

value.name: MAGGIE PAGANO: Nigel Farage takes aim at NatWest again
value.description: They have obviously learned nothing from the scandal, which also saw the head of Coutts sacked after it became public that the private bank had compiled a whopping Stasi-style dossier on Farage and his politics ... the UK has been in and out of recession ...

value.name: Russian diplomats ‘summoned’ following Alexei Navalny’s death
value.description: Foreign Office officials have summoned the Russian Embassy amid anger in Western capitals over the death of jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny.

value.name: UK election cyber-attack warning after Putin’s hackers target US
value.description: Putin-backed Russian hackers behind a large-scale attack on the US are engaging in a campaign of “cyber warfare” ahead of elections in America and the UK, security sources have warned.

value.name: The UK is officially (still) one of the most democratic countries in the world
value.description: In the report, EIU suggested that the UK has enjoyed a much more politically stable year (congrats to us for keeping the same prime minister for a whole twelve months). It said: ‘There has been a small improvement in the country’s score for social cohesion: divisions over Brexit have receded and support for independence in Scotland has declined.

value.name: By-elections: Tory gloom deepens after double poll blow
value.description: And in Kingswood, near Bristol, they got a share of the vote greater than the gap between the victorious Labour candidate and the Tory runner-up. That is a double dose of the heebie-jeebies delivered in one day to nervous Tories.

value.name: Could Reform UK surge sink Tory election hopes?
value.description: Reform UK leader Richard Tice has said he wants to "smash" and "destroy" the Tory Party at the general election. He insisted Reform UK would never consider repeating the Brexit Party's 2019 deal with the Conservatives - which saw it withdraw candidates in 317 constituencies after then-Tory leader Boris Johnson committed to leaving the EU by 2020.

value.name: Deepfakes could swing close UK election or referendum, Sadiq Khan suggests
value.description: Deepfakes could swing a close UK election or referendum in future, the Mayor of London has suggested. Sadiq Khan, who fell victim to a fake AI recording of him supposedly making inflammatory remarks in the run up to Armistice Day protests last year,

value.name: Campaign launched to protect UK religious broadcasting
value.description: A campaign has been launched to protect religious programmes from potential cuts in a new Media Bill going through Parliament.

value.name: Pollster offers by-election verdict as Reform UK surges – and it's bad news for everyone
value.description: The Tories have taken a kicking, Labour have two new MPs and Reform are flying high - but Professor Sir John Curtice warns that the real losers were everyone.

value.name: Reform UK secures best-ever by-election results
value.description: Richard Tice says the votes are a ‘defining moment’ and the party is now a ‘significant force’ in UK politics ahead of the general election

value.name: Lib Dem gain from Labour in Hull by-election
value.description: As well as the two Parliamentary by-elections, we had five principal authority council by-elections too. Four out of five had Lib Dems.
